pros: University Hospital  is level 1 trauma for the state of n.j. the experience and team work that is at this facility is amazing.The hospital compassion for the patients has allowed its expertise to go into the community to asset the needs at hand,Team work at the University Hospital make the dream work.

job_title: Diet Control Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: Patients are wonderful, easy to engage, and also form a challenge depending on the patient. Very rewarding when you actually get a chance to help them.
cons:
Management is questionable
Favoritism
Unwelcoming
Does not want to see you move forward

review_title: Awesome place to get training and get experience, especially clinical but..
pros: This is an awesome place to work in.  There are a lot of talented people and good environment for learning, especially the clinical aspect of it.  Also a great environment for new managers to learn how to handle difficult employees and situations.  Salary scale is higher than other hospitals in the area.
cons:
For the most part, the hardest part is dealing with employees who have been here for a long time.  This was probably their first job right out of school and they are used to doing it the way it has always been and they never kept up with what is happening outside of the University. 

Working here feels like the blind leading the blind.  If you are a new person and you can see, these blind folks would poke your eye so you become like them.  They do not like people who asks a lot of questions especially if it pertains to their job.  It is losing a lot of money because everyone is passing the buck or just do not want to take ownership.  They are still running that hospital as if it were the 80s.  

It seems like nobody knows what the other person is doing even though their jobs are interconnected.  Once that person leaves the person taking over have to start from scratch. 

There is no time clock so if you are a manager....forget it.  You have employees whom you cannot track or find.  They come in and leave whenever they want to and will have the nerve to ask for overtime because they did not finish their tasks.   I don't understand why they won't invest in a time clock.

review_title: At this hospital, you will get great, raw clinical experience. It has challenges, but not too bad.
job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Newark, NJ
pros: The clinical experience is great. You will see/learn a lot and the staff (especially the doctors) for the most part are very open to teaching/explaining cases if asked. The pay is good.
cons: The environment is stressed at times and not due to the job itself, but mainly administration. There is no appreciation and they treat you  inferior. The response from them is dependent upon your job title, so the lower you are the less attentive/respectful they are to your needs. The environment can be confrontational at times with staff and patients alike. Due to the patient demographics, I feel like most staff is not empathetic to their needs or situation and are quick to judge causing them to give mediocre care as opposed to treating everyone the same regardless of looks or demeanor. They need to improve patient care and satisfaction and eliminate the bad staff and management because in a lot of cases, the staff bedside manners are horrible and they don't know how to talk to the patients, instead they talk at them.

review_title: Great place to start your career, but needs improvement for staff retention rates.
pros: UH is a community hospital that looks to better the health and lives of those in the Newark community. For employees, the health care benefits are great and the diverse atmosphere is refreshing.
cons: Poor staff retention rate due to overworking of staff and the inability to pay employees at market value in their careers. It is also challenging to move forward professionally when employees are not recognized for their worth after many years of working at UH.

job_title: Staff Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist in Newark, NJ
pros: New contract with some of the better rates in the area.  New grads starting at over $140,000.  Graduated salaries with 10 years experience earning as much as $191,000 base pay.  Shift, Holiday, weekend and on call pay add up to much more.  Plenty of overtime
cons: Very challenging patient environment.  Typically ASA 3,4,5 patients.  Department Leadership is excellent.  Hospital Leadership is too new to tell but things look good

job_title: Medical Records Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: It is Interesting working with professional staff such as surgeons and technicians. The administrative staff is highly knowledgeable and friendly, and patients are diverse.
cons: The University houses a variety of disciplines and it is a challenge to get managers to agree on workload from one facility to another.

review_title: Good place to work, excellent benefits and generous pension for full time employees.
pros: Good management communication, great cafeteria, parking is on site, and up to date technology. Burger King on site and other restaurants very close.
cons: Unsafe area, mainly at night (worked overnight). Parking is deducted from payroll. Online payroll does not match the weeks you are actually getting paid, tends to get confusing.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Newark, NJ
pros: Good pay.  You get great experience as an EMT for UH.  You will grow significantly clinically.
cons: Very stressful working conditions so you must be up to the challenge.  It is well worth if you can adapt.

pros:
Community driven company that works with the Newark community through various events in and out of the hospital
Great group of people that are consistently looking for ways to improve the hospital and the patients experience.  
Great benefits and vacation time
cons: If you are new you can get lost easily and that sometimes can be intimidating.

pros: Very good pay for pharmacy Technician everywhere else pays less great people great benefits so far I love it here ..just a range $18-25 as long as you have a ptcb your fine.. highest paying hospital for pharmacy technicians
cons: There is no room for growth in the pharmacy department unless you go back to school and become a pharmacist which is understandable

job_title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist in Newark, NJ

cons: State Hospital,  slow to change, much older forms of documentation and procedures,  yet all of the newest equipment.

pros: Being employed at UH has been a great learning experience. If you're looking for a challenging environment this is definitely it!

pros: My colleagues care for patients and have a beautiful passion.

Patient care is what we should be focusing on. The review was never posted. CEO Ignores you, walks right by you and even ignores you on the elevator.
